comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Her husband died on January 7, 1924 : Newbold L. Edgar Dies Of Apoplexy. Lawyer Stricken Suddenly at His Country Home in Tuxedo at 61 Years. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50C1EFD3E5D1A72...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The article Richard Arthur Norton has pointed to gives her maiden name as Miss Marie Manice. books.google.com/books?id=8k9KAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA55 gives his middle name as LeRoy.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Sept 8, 1903 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0615F7385D16738... announces the death of her father, William de Forest Manice of Tuxedo Park, NY. She and Edgar were already married.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: According to this site, she married Count Alexander Mercati in 1926. She died in New York on Feb. 4, 1951 at age 82. www.wargs.com/royal/daria.html A short article about the wedding and the new Countess. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20710F93F581B7A... And some revolting praise from the Countess for Hitler in 1933, among other things justifying his treatment of the Jews as a means of defeating Communism. archives.nyphil.org/index.php/artifact/fb2fdbeb-686f-4f9d... Another photo from the Bain collection, not yet on Flickr: www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/ggbain.24432/?co=ggbain
